item.title: Senior Expert for Implementing Agricultural Surveys (Cat.I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance to Upgrade the Rwanda Agriculture Survey

To support the Government of Rwanda in accelerating the production of quality disaggregated data on the technical, economic, environmental and social dimensions of agricultural holdings, thereby strengthening the country’s capacity to monitor progress towards its national, regional and global development policy frameworks.

Duration of project: one year (upto 130 working days)

Senior Expert for Implementing Agricultural Surveys (Cat.I) – 130 working days

Qualification and skills:

  • University- or postgraduate degree in agronomy, agricultural sciences, rural development, economics, social sciences, statistics or any other subject closely related to the present ToR.

Professional experience:

  • At least 12 years of successful professional experience in designing and implementing agriculture surveys
  • At least 12 years of successful professional experience in the preparation, implementation, analysis and reporting of agricultural statistics and other related surveys in rural areas.
  • Profound experience in the agriculture sector in Rwanda will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

item.title: Planning and Performance Management Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Review of the National Programme for Sub-National Democratic Development (SNDD)

The overall purpose of this MTR is to identify and justify a set of clear recommendations to improve and adjust the NP and its implementation. Prior to making these recommendations, a review of relevance, implementation progress, effectiveness, efficiency, constraints and key issues will be carried out. This review is an intermediate step aimed at collecting compelling evidence and providing the clear reasoning required to design actions that will be adopted to improve performance.

These recommendations will be in several areas, including recommendations: (i) to revise the NP; (ii) to better implement the second IP3; (iii) to improve the results frameworks, to ensure targets are realistic and credible and that the indicators selected can be used to effectively manage performance, (iv) to outline a broad strategy and indicative costs for the third platform of the NP, and (v) to improve program management, coordination, capacity development, evaluation capacity and learning and other key institutional processes.

The MTR will be considered successful to the degree there is buy-in in terms of its findings and to the degree it results in actual changes in the future. As such, the first and foremost user of the Mid-Term Review will be the Royal Government of Cambodia, and particularly the NCDD-S.

Development partners supporting the NP-SNDD will also be main users. The NP is mainly funded through a basket-fund program based approach, administered by the NCDD-S. Sida, Switzerland and the EU are the contributors to the basket fund. The NP is also implemented through bilateral agreements between the RGC and donors such as ADB, UNDP, UNICEF, UN women, UNFPA, World Bank, GIZ/BMZ, as well as civil society.

Planning and Performance Management Expert (Category II): 25 person-days

Qualifications and skills: Education: at least a Master’s Degree/MBA; in its absence, equivalent 9 years professional experience in management (including general professional experience listed below).

General professional experience: At least 6 years' experience in management.

Specific professional experience: The expert must demonstrate substantive experience in the following areas:

  • Design, implementation and assessment of monitoring and evaluation systems;

  • Design, implementation and assessment of performance management systems;

  • Participation as expert in at least one evaluation.

  • At least one experience in M&E and performance management in the public sector context

  • Prior experience in decentralisation, deconcentration, local governance, will be an advantage

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Category 1 - Capacity Building Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Technical Assistance for Identification and Formulation of 11th EDF Support for Civil Society

The global objective is to assist the government of Botswana and the European Commission in the three phases of programming of EU’s development cooperation with Botswana under the 11th EDF for support to civil society.

The specific objective is to provide the Government of Botswana and the European Commission with sufficient information to finalise, in good time, the identification and formulation phases of EU support for civil society, under the 11th EDF.

Category 1 - Capacity Building Expert

Education

  • A least a Master’s Degree in Social Sciences, Political Science, Development Economics or Public Administration or equivalent educational background of professional experience.

General Professional Experience

  • A minimum of 12 years of work experience designing, implementing and/or managing measures to build the capacity of civil society organisations.

Specific Professional Experience

  • At least 10 years of experience in developing capacity enhancement and organisational sustainability strategies for civil society in upper middle income countries
  • Extensive knowledge of participatory organisation analyses and needs diagnostics.
  • Experience with design and delivery of training support to various forms of CSOs
  • Extensive knowledge of resource mobilisation strategies for CSOs
  • Experience with effective networking approaches for CSOs.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
*Assessment and Review of the 2015 DCFTA SRC Payment Tranche * *Global objective * To assess and value the second (variable) tranche of the DCFTA SRC, representing the 2016 DCFTA SRC Policy Matrix activities.

*Specific objective(s) *

  • To assess the compliance with the SRC general conditions on Public Policy,;
  • To assess and value the degree of attainment of the 2015 DCFTA SRC specific conditions as per the 2015 DCFTA SRC Policy Matrix activities;
  • To provide analytical DCFTA SRC information and assessment services in order to allow the relevant European Union services to embed the assessment of the 2015 DCFTA SRC general and specific conditions in a broader context

Expert in SMEs and Investment & Promotion (Category II) (minimum 15 working-days)

Education

  • A Master’s degree in the field of economics or business sciences or in its absence
  • 7 years of professional experience in addition to the required professional experience indicated below in the sectors related to this lot. Experience
  • At least 6 years of professional experience in the sectors related to this lot;
  • At least 3 years of experience in Technical assistance projects related to small and medium sized (SME) enterprise development and export and investment (E&I) promotion, ideally, within an international trade context.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English;
  • Romanian and/or Russian language skills would be an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to corinamaria_campian@dai.com

item.description:
*Assisting in the evaluation of grant applications received in the framework of the call for proposals ‘SWIM II’ Demonstration projects' * The objective of the project is to assist the Contracting Authority in the selection of the best proposals received under the call for proposals “SWIM II Demonstration Projects” and to achieve a high-quality, complete and coherent selection process of projects in line with the criteria set in the Guidelines for applicants.

Two Assessors with Extensive Experience in Water Management Projects (Cat. I, tentatively 16 w/d each):

Qualifications and skills

  • University degree or equivalent in a relevant field.
  • Strong written skills
  • Fluency in English is required.
  • Strong working knowledge of French (for the evaluation of Concept Notes and Full Applications submitted in French).

Professional experience and knowledge:

  • At least 12 years of demonstrated experience in designing, implementing, monitoring and/or evaluating water management project.
  • Good knowledge of the political, economic and social context of the beneficiary countries is an asset.
  • Familiarity with EU funded Call for Proposals.
  • Strong familiarity with Project Cycle Management and Logical Framework Analysis.

item.title: Expert-Comptable
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assistance technique auprès du Ministère du Commerce et de la Consommation pour la gestion du devis programme de 950 000 pour la mise en œuvre de l'APE-I

L’objectif de la mission est de permettre l’atteinte des résultats visés dans le devis programme à travers une gestion technique et financière et contractuelle saine, efficace et efficiente.

Expert-Comptable (CAT. III, 82 h/j):

Formation:

  • Diplôme d'expert-comptable ou équivalent;

Expérience professionnelle générale:

  • Expérience confirmée (3 ans minimum) dans la gestion de projets de développement complexes impliquant la tenue d’une comptabilité analytique détaillée ;
  • Grande aptitude de travail en équipe ;
  • Maitrise des outils informatiques les plus courants : traitement de texte, tableurs, base de données, internet et des logiciels de comptabilité;

Expérience professionnelle spécifique:

  • Expérience des procédures FED exigée (procédures de gestion administrative, financière et contractuelle de la coopération extérieure de l’UE);
  • Au moins trois expériences dans la gestion de devis-programmes selon les règles du FED avec des montants de Devis-Programmes supérieurs à €800K
  • Parfaite maîtrise du français,
  • Connaissance du malgache serait un atout

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: Senior Expert in Business & Change Management (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Programme Director - Turks and Caicos Islands Business Transformation Programme

Overall objective

The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is to bring about sustainable and inclusive economic growth that will raise living standards and provide more jobs for Islanders and other residents of the Turks and Caicos Islands.

Purpose The purpose of this contract is to monitor and to coordinate the implementation of the Turks and Caicos Islands' Business Reform Strategy.

Results to be achieved by the Contractor:

  • The Business Reform Strategy Plan is regularly updated with relevant and credible deliverables, activities; timeline and budget.
  • The implementation of the Business Reform Strategy is on track with the Plan
  • Its performance is monitored through clear objective and measurable indicators. Progress on key elements is assessed on the basis of baselines.

Project description

The Technical assistant, Programme Director, is required to co-ordinate efforts in delivering the Business Reform Strategy and to lead and manage the TCIG Delivery Team. This team will be drawn from across the civil service and may later include individuals seconded from the private sector. The Programme Director will have a watching brief to ensure that specific EU conditions and targets are met and the monitoring requirements are in place. The EU programme is parallel to – but separate from – the implementation of the Delivery Strategy.

The Programme Director will be responsible for implementing the agreed Business Reform Strategy and ensuring that the TCIG meets the Business Reform Strategy targets. The detailed terms of reference for the Programme Director are essentially set out in the revised and updated delivery plan for 2016.

Senior Expert in Business & Change Management (TL)

Qualifications and skills

  • A first degree with concentration in economics, business, organisational development and/or capacity building required.
  • Post-graduate degree (e.g. MBA) or professional management qualification in economics, business, organisational development and capacity building is highly desirable.

General professional experience

  • The expert will have at least 10 years of experience in economics, business, organizational development and/or capacity building. Specific professional experience
  • Experience in Strategic Planning and Team Leadership is essential.
  • Project management skills, training and experience is required.
  • Knowledge of change management and workforce & business re-design.
  • Knowledge of developing and implementing policies and procedures. The expert must be independent and free from conflicts of interest in the responsibilities they take on.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to CorinaMaria_Campian@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.title: Category II Garment Supply Chain Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study on Garment Ethiopia

The overall objective of the assignment is to analyse the viability of making Ethiopia a pilot country under the EU garment initiative. The feasibility study would assess the situation on the ground and the political economy including key stakeholders such as the government, industry, NGOs, and other donors, thus providing a credible country-specific gap analysis to assess in which areas of the garment supply chain in Ethiopia EU action would be particularly valuable, with a detailed qualitative analysis supported by quantitative data. This includes demonstrating the importance of universal values for competitiveness in the post-2015 markets for the garment industry, including e.g. mainstreaming the promotion of good governance, and environmental sustainability.

Category II Garment Supply Chain Expert

  • University degree in development studies, economics, business administration, law or equivalent.
  • Minimum 6 years of professional experience in economic/trade/supply chain with EU institutions or in the design and delivery of EU cooperation programmes.
  • At least 2 years of professional experience in Ethiopia.
  • Extensive knowledge of the textile/garment sector in Ethiopia.
  • Extensive knowledge of the global debate, international reference frameworks and EU work on responsible supply chains in the textile/garment sector, covering all dimensions of sustainability.
  • Experience in collection, screening and analysis of large amounts of information from different sources including its consolidation and targeted condensation.
  • Excellent research-oriented skills.
  • Fluency and excellent English report writing skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Garment Supply Chain Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study on Garment Ethiopia

The overall objective of the assignment is to analyse the viability of making Ethiopia a pilot country under the EU garment initiative. The feasibility study would assess the situation on the ground and the political economy including key stakeholders such as the government, industry, NGOs, and other donors, thus providing a credible country-specific gap analysis to assess in which areas of the garment supply chain in Ethiopia EU action would be particularly valuable, with a detailed qualitative analysis supported by quantitative data. This includes demonstrating the importance of universal values for competitiveness in the post-2015 markets for the garment industry, including e.g. mainstreaming the promotion of good governance, and environmental sustainability.

Senior Garment Supply Chain Expert

  • Master’s degree in development studies, economics, business administration, law or equivalent.
  • At least 12 years of professional experience in economic/trade/supply chain analysis. Experience with EU institutions or in the design and delivery of EU cooperation programmes would be considered as an asset.
  • At least 5 years of professional experience in Ethiopia.
  • Extensive knowledge of the textile/garment sector in Ethiopia.
  • Extensive knowledge of the global debate, international reference frameworks and EU work on responsible supply chains in the textile/garment sector, covering all dimensions of sustainability.
  • Extensive experience in forging effective working relationships with business, government and civil society representatives.
  • Broad network in garment sector in Ethiopia will be an asset.
  • Excellent analytical and research-oriented skills.
  • Fluency and excellent English report writing skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Environmental Management Specialist (or related field) (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Improving Connection Uptake to Sewerage Networks in serviced areas in Maseru

The global objective of this assignment is to contribute to the improvement of the overall urban environment and to contribute to the financial viability of WASCO and the urban planning of Maseru City Council as service providers.

The specific objective of this assignment is to support both Maseru City Council and WASCO in increasing the connection uptake in those serviced areas with existing networks for sewage collection.

Senior Environmental Management Specialist (or related field) (Category I)

  • Post-graduate degree in Environmental Management, Public Health or any other related field. (Master’s degree or equivalent through work experience).
  • At least twelve (12) years of relevant experience in capacity building and or community mobilization in the water and sanitation sector;
  • Demonstrated experience in buy-in mechanism to change people’s minds or behaviour in sanitation and hygiene;
  • Demonstrated ability to understand people’s reactions (social perspective) and understanding why they react as they do;
  • Relevant working experience in the broader region and / or Lesotho will be considered an asset;
  • Demonstrated cross-cultural sensitivity; interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills;
  • Computer literacy, excellent report writing skills and ability to produce quality documents;
  • Good analytical skills.
  • Fluency in English language (understanding, reading and writing is indispensable for this assignment
  • Substantive experience with programmes dealing with waste water management and sewerage connections;
  • Extensive knowledge of bylaws governing local permits and regulations;
  • Experience in and detailed knowledge of economic, financial and institutional analysis in the water and sanitation sector.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com
